emuInput.TitMainTitle: Two fire fighters on porch roof of burning house, 1502 Brushton Avenue, Penn Township
emuInput.CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 29, 1955, pg. 6, reads: "Fire at 1502 Brushton Avenue, Penn Twp...13 lost home in blaze Saturday." Accompanying article reads: "13 Homeless in Penn Twp. Fire - Thirteen persons, including Mr. and Mrs. Robert Whittington, two daughters and sons-in-law, Mr. and Mrs. Richard Love and Mr. and Mrs. James Williams, and seven grandchildren lost their home at 1502 Brushton Avenue Saturday morning when fire raged through this house destroying all their possessions.  City firemen and a Penn Township volunteer fire company fought the blaze.  Red Cross officials gave the family a $20 food order, two cots, four blankets, four dozen diapers, outer clothing, and a promise to aid with furniture later.  The families are currently staying at the home of another daughter-in-law, Mrs. Dorothy M. Wynn, 1015 Wheeler Street. - Harris Photo."
